visual_evidence.spatial: Attention is focused on the central region with central distribution.
visual_evidence.intensity: Model shows very high attention intensity, concentrated pattern.

local_knowledge.content: Adenocarcinoma typically presents in the peripheral regions of the lung, often in the outer third of the lung parenchyma. This peripheral location is a key distinguishing feature.
local_knowledge.source: Travis WD et al., WHO Classification of Tumours of the Lung, 2021

local_knowledge.content: Ground-glass opacity (GGO) on CT imaging is frequently associated with adenocarcinoma. GGO appears as hazy increase in lung attenuation without obscuration of underlying vessels.
local_knowledge.source: Hansell DM et al., Fleischner Society Glossary, Radiology 2008

pubmed_knowledge.title: CT characteristics of solitary pulmonary capillary hemangioma versus lung adenocarcinoma.
pubmed_knowledge.source: Wan Q et al., Cancer Imaging, 2026

pubmed_knowledge.title: Many-Faced Imitator: A Case of Acinar Adenocarcinoma of the Lung Resembling Miliary Tuberculosis.
pubmed_knowledge.source: Valdes Bracamontes MD et al., Cureus, 2025

image_path: d:\Major Project\archive (1)\Lung Cancer Dataset\Benign cases\Benign cases  (19).jpg

visual_evidence.spatial: Attention is focused on the central region with central distribution.
visual_evidence.intensity: Model shows very high attention intensity, moderate pattern.

local_knowledge.content: Benign lung lesions include granulomas and hamartomas. These typically have smooth, well-defined margins and stable size over time.
local_knowledge.source: MacMahon H et al., Lung Nodule Guidelines, Radiology 2017

local_knowledge.content: Benign nodules often demonstrate characteristic calcification patterns. Stability over 2 years is a strong indicator of benign etiology.
local_knowledge.source: MacMahon H et al., Lung Nodule Guidelines, Radiology 2017

pubmed_knowledge.title: Prone positioning in cone beam CT-guided robotic bronchoscopy case series: a strategy to minimize atelectasis and improve access to posteromedial lower lobe nodules.
pubmed_knowledge.source: Alraiyes AH et al., J Thorac Dis, 2025

pubmed_knowledge.title: Beyond Morphology: Quantitative MR Relaxometry in Pulmonary Lesion Classification.

image_path: d:\Major Project\archive (1)\Lung Cancer Dataset\large cell carcinoma\large cell carcinoma (1).png

visual_evidence.spatial: Attention is focused on the central region with central distribution.
visual_evidence.intensity: Model shows very high attention intensity, concentrated pattern.

local_knowledge.content: Large cell carcinoma typically presents as a large peripheral mass with rapid growth. It tends to be aggressive with early metastasis.
local_knowledge.source: Travis WD et al., WHO Classification of Tumours of the Lung, 2021

local_knowledge.content: Large cell carcinoma is undifferentiated and often shows heterogeneous enhancement on CT with areas of necrosis.

pubmed_knowledge.title: Large cell carcinoma of the lung: LDCT features and survival in screen-detected cases.
pubmed_knowledge.source: Mascalchi M et al., Eur J Radiol, 2024

pubmed_knowledge.title: Unusual acute liver failure from small cell carcinoma of the lung.
pubmed_knowledge.source: Arif H et al., Clin Exp Hepatol, 2018

image_path: d:\Major Project\archive (1)\Lung Cancer Dataset\Normal cases\Normal cases (340).jpg

visual_evidence.spatial: Attention is focused on the central region with central distribution.
visual_evidence.intensity: Model shows very high attention intensity, concentrated pattern.

local_knowledge.content: Normal lung parenchyma appears as low-attenuation tissue with visible pulmonary vessels. Lung fields should be clear without focal opacities.
local_knowledge.source: Webb WR et al., High-Resolution CT of the Lung, 2014

image_path: d:\Major Project\archive (1)\Lung Cancer Dataset\squamous cell carcinoma\squamous cell carcinoma (201).png

visual_evidence.spatial: Attention is focused on the middle right region with central distribution.
visual_evidence.intensity: Model shows very high attention intensity, concentrated pattern.

local_knowledge.content: Squamous cell carcinoma typically arises in the central airways, near the hilum. This central location reflects its origin from bronchial epithelium.
local_knowledge.source: Travis WD et al., WHO Classification of Tumours of the Lung, 2021

local_knowledge.content: Squamous cell carcinoma has the highest propensity for cavitation among lung cancers due to central tumor necrosis.
local_knowledge.source: Chaudhuri MR, Br J Dis Chest 1973

pubmed_knowledge.title: Imaging appearances, CT evolution patterns, and surgical prognosis of stage I lung squamous cell carcinoma.
pubmed_knowledge.source: Zhao WH et al., Cancer Imaging, 2025

pubmed_knowledge.title: Radiological precursor lesions of lung squamous cell carcinoma: Early progression patterns and divergent volume doubling time between hilar and peripheral zones.
pubmed_knowledge.source: Sugawara H et al., Lung Cancer, 2023
